title: Stencil font combined with fraktur
content:
Hello,

I have trouble finding the name of the typefaces in the picture attatched.  
Picture is taken from a Dutch newspaper (Bruges).

Thanks in advance,

N.

Font: 

 Stencil Std 

Solved By: 

 [Les ONeill](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235804/http:/typophile.com/user/216897 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [IMG\_8464.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235804/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_8464.JPG) | 1.48 MB |
author: Niels B.

comments.content: The stencil is called 'Stencil Std' available from Adobe and possibly other foundries

The Fraktur nameplate looks like custom lettering based on William H. Bradley's dramatic redesign of blackletter in the 1890s and digitized as Bradley Pro by Ralph M. Unger

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235804im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BradleyProInUse_6191.jpg)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/bradley/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235804/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/bradley/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/bradley/")  
Of course somebody could have produced this as a font, but I have not seen it.  
Don

Close to sample: Silver Graphics/Hapsburg  
Luc Devroye, Silver Graphics: "Company run by Roger Hartley, Pennington Gap, VA. The link went dead--its parent is The Design Center / DT&G. Some of the fonts are ..., and Hapsburg."

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415235804im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hand1_5745.jpg)

Perfect! Thanks a lot!

Cheers,

N.
